intro: Chassalia longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Chassalia longifolia is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
